review.title: Generalized Neutrosophic Soft Set
review.abstract: In this paper we present a new concept called generalized neutrosophic soft set. This concept incorporates the beneficial properties of both generalized neutrosophic set introduced by A.A. Salama [7]and soft set techniques proposed by Molodtsov [4]. We also study some properties of this concept. Some definitions and operations have been introduced on generalized neutrosophic soft set. Finally we present an application of generalized neuutrosophic soft set in decision making problem.

metadata.title: Generalized Neutrosophic Soft Set

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijcseit.2013.3202 17In this paper we present a new concept called "Generalized Neutrosophic Soft Set." This concept includes the beneficial properties of both the generalized Neutrosophic Quantity introduced by A.Salama [7] and the Soft Set Techniques proposed by Molodtsov [4]. We also examine some properties of this concept. Some definitions and operations have been introduced on generalized Neutrosophic Soft Set.

sections.heading: KEYWORDS
sections.text: Soft Sets, Neutrosophical Sets, General Neutrosophical Sets, General Neutrosophical Soft Sets.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: In many complicated problems such as, technical problems, social, economic, computer science, medical science... etc, the associated data are not necessarily crisp, precise and deterministic because of their vague nature. Most of these problems were solved by various theories. One of these theories was the fuzzy set theory discovered by Lotfi, Zadeh in 1965 [1], later several researches present a series of results with different directions of fuzzy set such as: Interval fuzzy set [12], generalized fuzzy set of Atanassov [2]..., all of these are to some extent successful in dealing with the problems that exist due to the uncertainty in the real world, but there are also cases where these theories do not provide satisfactory results, possibly due to vague and contradictory information that exist in the belief system, then in 1995, Smarandache [3] initiates the theory of neutrrosophical set theory as a new mathematical set of unspecified theory, but there may be unspecified theory in this theory, due to the unspecified theory of optics [3]

sections.heading: 3. Generalized Neutrosophic Soft Set
sections.text: In this section we will begin with the study of the hybrid structure, which is both the generalized neutrosophical set theory and the theory of soft sets. sections.heading: 4.1. Definition: Comparison matrix.
sections.text: The comparison matrix is a matrix whose rows are identified by the object names of the universe such as b1, b2, · ·, bn and the columns by the parameters e1, e2, · · ·, em. Entries are cij, where cij is the number of parameters for which the value of bi exceeds the value of bi or is equal to the value of bj. Entries are calculated by cij = a + d - c, where "a" is the integer as "howInternational Journal of Computer Science, Engineering and Information Technology (IJCSEIT), Vol.3, No.2, April2013many times exceeds Tbi (ej) or equal to Tbk (ej)" is the integer as "howInternational Journal of Computer Science, Engineering and Information Technology (IJCSEIT), Vol.3, No.2, April 2013many times Tbi (ej).bb is the integer of" Integer "which is" bj-bd. "

sections.heading: 5. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: In this article we wanted to integrate the generalized neutrosophical set proposed by A. A. Salama [7] into soft sets introduced by Molodtsov [4], since the parameters (which are words or sentences) are mostly generalized neutrosophical sets; but both concepts deal with inaccuracies. We have also defined some operations on GNSS and present an application of GNSS in a decision-making problem. Finally, we hope that our model will open up a new direction, a new way of thinking for engineers, mathematicians, computer scientists and many others in various tests.

sections.heading: ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
sections.text: Our special thanks go to the anonymous arbitrator and the editor of this magazine for their valuable comments and suggestions, which have improved this work.

, all these are successful to some extent in dealing with the problems arising due to the vagueness present in the real world ,but there are also cases where these theories failed to give satisfactory results, possibly due to indeterminate and inconsistent information which exist in belief system, then in 1995, Smarandache [3] initiated the theory of neutrosophic set as new mathematical tool for handling problems involving imprecise, indeterminacy, and inconsistent data.

Furthermore, In 1999, a Russian mathematician (Molodtsov [4]) introduce a new mathematical tool for dealing with uncertainties, called “soft set theory”.
After Molodtsov’work, there have been many researches in combining fuzzy set with soft set, which incorporates the beneficial properties of both fuzzy set and soft set techniques ( see [11] [6] [8]).

metadata.abstractText: In this paper we present a new concept called “generalized neutrosophic soft set”. This concept incorporates the beneficial properties of both generalized neutrosophic set introduced by A.A.Salama [7] and soft set techniques proposed by Molodtsov [4]. We also study some properties of this concept. Some definitions and operations have been introduced on generalized neutrosophic soft set. Finally we present an application of generalized neuutrosophic soft set in decision making problem.
